wikitext.*:
{{disambig-more|J.R.R. Tolkien|[[J.R.R. Tolkien (disambiguation)]]}} {{book |title=J.R.R. Tolkien: The Art of the Manuscript | image = The Art of the Manuscript.png |author=[[William M. Fliss]], [[Sarah C. Schaefer]], and others |illustrator=[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] (manuscripts and artwork) |publisher=Haggerty Museum of Art, Marquette University |date=[[2022]] |format=Hardcover; paperback |pages=196 |isbn=9780945366355 }} '''''J.R.R. Tolkien: The Art of the Manuscript''''' is an exhibition catalogue which accompanies an [[2022]] exhibition of the same name. The exhibition was held between [[19 August]] and [[23 December]] [[2022]], organized collaboratively by [[Marquette University]]'s Raynor Memorial Libraries and the Haggerty Museum of Art, curated by Tolkien Archivist [[William M. Fliss]] and Dr. [[Sarah C. Schaefer]]. The book reproduces the complete object list in color, including 147 items both from Marquette's collection and from other repositories, many of which have never been exhibited or published.{{webcite|articleurl=https://www.facebook.com/TolkienMarquette/posts/pfbid0aaD2pVeU19XraDZpdGSNe9m6JkMWPZH1gt7r8Gv98RrWj4dGxJSSX2A7SKg3gFgol|articlename=Facebok post at the page of the J R R Tolkien Collection - Marquette University Libraries|dated=29 July 2022|website=FB|accessed=5 August 2022}}{{webcite|articleurl=https://www.eventbrite.com/e/jrr-tolkien-the-art-of-the-manuscript-tickets-224292042537|articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien: The Art of the Manuscript by Haggerty Museum of Art|website=[https://www.eventbrite.com eventbrite.com]|accessed=5 August 2022}} It was also nominated for the [[Tolkien Society Awards|Tolkien Society Award]] for the best book in [[2023]].[https://www.tolkiensociety.org/2023/04/winners-of-the-tolkien-society-awards-2023-announced/ Winners of The Tolkien Society Awards 2023 announced] at TolkienSociety.org (accessed 19 June 2023) ==Contents== * Director's Foreword ** by Susan Longhenry * "The Art of the Manuscript" (Not present in the first edition) ** by [[Simon Tolkien]] * Introduction ** by [[Sarah C. Schaefer]] and [[William M. Fliss]] * "Tolkien and the Manuscript Tradition: A Re-Collation" ** by [[Sarah C. Schaefer]] * "A Journey down the Great River of Wilderland: Mapping the Manuscripts for ''The Lord of the Rings''" ** by [[William M. Fliss]] * Plates *# Rooted Works *# Records of Ancient Days *# Fair Letters *# Old Times and Distant Lands *# Glimpsing Other-worlds * Selected Bibliography ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|Marquette University's Raynor Memorial Libraries and the Haggerty Museum of Art collaboratively present this exhibition focused on the work of celebrated author and artist J.R.R. Tolkien (1892-1973), best known for his literary classics The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.
The exhibition considers Tolkien’s work through the lens of manuscripts, in terms of both the materials that Tolkien studied as a medieval philologist and the manuscripts that he created while developing his collected writings on Middle-earth. Professor Tolkien was deeply immersed in the complexities of manuscripts, and this exhibition will illustrate how different aspects of the manuscript tradition found expression within Tolkien’s scholarly life and in his creative writing.
Founded on Marquette's [https://www.marquette.edu/library/archives/tolkien.php J.R.R. Tolkien Collection], the exhibition also includes items borrowed from other repositories, including a significant number of Tolkien manuscripts and artwork from the [[Bodleian Libraries]] at the University of Oxford. Many of the 147 items in the exhibition have not previously been exhibited or published.
The exhibition is accompanied by a 196-page hardbound catalogue that reproduces the complete object list, and includes introductory essays by exhibition co-curators William M. Fliss, PhD and Sarah C. Schaefer, PhD.}} ==Publication history and gallery== A second paperback edition was released in [[October]] [[2022]], which includes a new foreword by [[Simon Tolkien]], titled ''"The Art of the Manuscript"''.[https://shophaggerty.com/product/j-r-r-tolkien-the-art-of-the-manuscript-catalog-softcover-second-edition/ “J.R.R. Tolkien: The Art of the Manuscript” Catalog – Softcover, Second Edition] at ShopHaggerty.com (accessed 19 June 2023) File:The Art of the Manuscript.png|First edition hardcover File:The Art of the Manuscript second edition.png|Second edition paperback *First edition **Haggerty Museum of Art, hardcover ([[2022]]), pp. 196. ISBN 9780945366355 *Second edition **Haggerty Museum of Art, paperback ([[2022]]), pp. 200. ISBN 9780945366362 ==See also== * [[Tolkien exhibitions]] ==External links== * [https://www.marquette.edu/haggerty-museum/tolkien.php Exhibition information] at Marquette.edu * [https://shophaggerty.com/product/j-r-r-tolkien-the-art-of-the-manuscript-catalog-softcover-second-edition/ Catalogue order information] at ShopHaggerty.com (currently unavailable) ===Interviews with the curators=== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L0AUokw3tws&ab_channel=TolkienCollector%27sGuide Bill Fliss and Sarah Schaefer discuss Tolkien Manuscript exhibition coming in 2022] on [[Tolkien Collector's Guide]]'s YouTube channel * [http://podcast.athrabeth.com/2022/12/07/episode-53-interview-with-dr-sarah-schaefer-and-dr-william-fliss-co-curators-of-j-r-r-tolkien-the-art-of-the-manuscript/ Interview with Dr. Sarah Schaefer and Dr. William Fliss, co-curators of J. R. R. Tolkien: The Art of the Manuscript] (episode 53 of the [[Athrabeth]] podcast * [https://www.tolkcast.de/episode/129-interview-mit-sarah-schaefer-bill-fliss 129 Interview mit Sarah Schaefer & Bill Fliss] (episode 129 of [[TolkCast]]) {{references}} {{Publishedmajorbooks}} {{title|italics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Art of the Manuscript}} [[Category:Exhibition catalogues]] [[Category:Publications by title]]
